page.title: 18CRANFIELD PAST AND PRESENT.
page.content: There are also moorhens, pigeons, wild ducks and geese, hedgehogs, weasels and stoats. There have been a few changes in the wildlife, but one of the main ones is that the rabbits were very nearly wiped out with myxomatosis but they are now coming back very rapidly. Also foxes, frogs and toads have almost disappeared and the wildlife is not what it used to be. PESTICIDE SPRAYS. Pesticide sprays have done great harm to all British wildlife.There aren't any butterflies compared to what there used to be. Many used to keep bees and pigs but today only a few keep their own hives of bees or their own pigs. SHOPS. The 1st shop in the village was a but- chers, followed by a grocers. Cigar- ettes would cost 11.5p in old money. A shopkeeper owned the 1st car.
